cyclone.name: FRED
cyclone.current_location: about 110 miles W of the Dry Tortugas, or 450 miles SSE of Pensacola, Florida
cyclone.trajectory: continuing north-northwest across the eastern Gulf of Mexico and expected to turn north toward the Florida Panhandle / Alabama coast, then weaken and track inland over the Southeast
cyclone.expected_landfall_location: northern Gulf Coast near the Florida Panhandleâ€“Alabama border

weather_observation.watch_coast: Alabama/Florida border eastward to Ochlockonee River, FL
weather_observation.warning_coast: None in effect (warnings possible later for the same stretch of the northern Gulf Coast)
weather_observation.impacted_coast: Northern Gulf Coast from Louisiana eastward to Florida Big Bend; inland Alabama, Georgia and the western Carolinas
weather_observation.closest_wind_data_location: None (no Northeast locations listed in wind-probability table)
weather_observation.wind: No significant tropical-cyclone winds expected at the port; only a slight increase in breezes possible late week as the remnants pass well inland.
weather_observation.rainfall: Light to locally moderate rainfall possible late week if the remnants move through the mid-Atlantic, but totals presently expected to stay below 2 inches.
weather_observation.other_hazards: None anticipated for port operations at this time
